tools.name: getClusterStatus
tools.title: getClusterStatus
tools.description: Checks the health status of the cluster by verifying if there's at least one partition with a healthy leader.

tools.name: getTopology
tools.title: getTopology
tools.description: Obtains the current topology of the cluster the gateway is part of.

tools.name: getIncident
tools.title: getIncident
tools.description: Get incident by key. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

incidentKey.description: The assigned key of the incident, which acts as a unique identifier for this incident.

tools.name: resolveIncident
tools.title: resolveIncident
tools.description: Resolve incident by key. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

incidentKey.description: Key of the incident to resolve.

tools.name: searchIncidents
tools.title: searchIncidents
tools.description: Search for incidents. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

from.description: Filter from this time (inclusive). RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2024-12-17T10:30:00Z' or '2024-12-17T10:30:00+01:00').

to.description: Filter up to this time (exclusive). RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2024-12-17T10:30:00Z' or '2024-12-17T10:30:00+01:00').

elementId.description: The element ID associated to this incident.

errorType.description: Incident error type with a defined set of values.

processDefinitionId.description: The process definition ID associated to this incident.

processDefinitionKey.description: The process definition key associated to this incident.

processInstanceKey.description: The process instance key associated to this incident.

state.description: State of this incident with a defined set of values.

filter.description: Filter search by the given fields

after.description: Use the `endCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the next page of results.

before.description: Use the `startCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the previous page of results.

from.description: The index of items to start searching from.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in one request.

tools.name: getProcessDefinition
tools.title: getProcessDefinition
tools.description: Get process definition by key. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

processDefinitionKey.description: The assigned key of the process definition, which acts as a unique identifier for this process definition.

tools.name: getProcessDefinitionXml
tools.title: getProcessDefinitionXml
tools.description: Get the BPMN XML of a process definition by key. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

processDefinitionKey.description: The assigned key of the process definition, which acts as a unique identifier for this process definition.

tools.name: searchProcessDefinitions
tools.title: searchProcessDefinitions
tools.description: Search for process definitions. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

hasStartForm.description: Indicates whether the start event of the process has an associated Form Key.

isLatestVersion.description: Whether to only return the latest version of each process definition. When using this filter, pagination functionality is limited, you can only paginate forward using `after` and `limit`. The response contains no `startCursor` in the `page`, and requests ignore the `from` and `before` in the `page`.

processDefinitionId.description: Process definition ID of this process definition.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key for this process definition.

resourceName.description: Resource name of this process definition.

versionTag.description: Version tag of this process definition.

filter.description: Filter search by the given fields

after.description: Use the `endCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the next page of results.

before.description: Use the `startCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the previous page of results.

from.description: The index of items to start searching from.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in one request.

tools.name: createProcessInstance
tools.title: createProcessInstance
tools.description:
Create a new process instance of the given process definition. Either a processDefinitionKey or
a processDefinitionId (with an optional processDefinitionVersion) need to be passed.

When using the awaitCompletion flag, the tool will wait for the process instance to complete
and return its result variables. When using awaitCompletion, always include a unique tag
`mcp-tool:<uniqueId>` which can be used to search for the started process instance in case
of timeouts.

processDefinitionKey.description: The assigned key of the process definition, which acts as a unique identifier for this process definition.

processDefinitionId.description: The BPMN process id of the process definition to start an instance of.

processDefinitionVersion.description: The version of the process. By default, the latest version of the process is used. Can only be used in combination with processDefinitionId.

variables.description: Set of variables to instantiate in the root variable scope of the process instance. Can include nested/complex objects. Which variables to set depends on the process definition.

awaitCompletion.description: Wait for the process instance to complete. If the process instance does not complete within request timeout limits, the waiting will time out and the tool will return a 504 response status. Use the unique tag you added to query process instance status. Disabled by default.

fetchVariables.description: List of variables by name to be included in the response when awaitCompletion is set to true. If empty, all visible variables in the root scope will be returned.

tags.description: List of tags to apply to the process instance. Tags must start with a letter, followed by letters, digits, or the special characters `_`, `-`, `:`, or `.`; length ≤ 100.

tools.name: getProcessInstance
tools.title: getProcessInstance
tools.description: Get process instance by key. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

processInstanceKey.description: The assigned key of the process instance, which acts as a unique identifier for this process instance.

tools.name: searchProcessInstances
tools.title: searchProcessInstances
tools.description: Search for process instances. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

from.description: Filter from this time (inclusive). RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2024-12-17T10:30:00Z' or '2024-12-17T10:30:00+01:00').

to.description: Filter up to this time (exclusive). RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2024-12-17T10:30:00Z' or '2024-12-17T10:30:00+01:00').

hasIncident.description: Whether this process instance has a related incident or not.

processInstanceKey.description: The key of this process instance.

tags.description: List of tags. Tags need to start with a letter; then alphanumerics, `_`, `-`, `:`, or `.`; length ≤ 100.

filter.description: Filter search by the given fields

after.description: Use the `endCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the next page of results.

before.description: Use the `startCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the previous page of results.

from.description: The index of items to start searching from.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in one request.

tools.name: assignUserTask
tools.title: assignUserTask
tools.description: Assign or unassign a user task. Provide an assignee to assign the task, or omit/provide null to unassign it.

assignee.description: The assignee for the user task. Provide a value to assign the task to that user, or omit/provide null to unassign the task.

action.description: A custom action value that will be accessible from user task events resulting from this endpoint invocation. If not provided, it will default to "assign".

allowOverride.description: By default, the task is reassigned if it was already assigned. Set this to `false` to return an error in such cases. The task must then first be unassigned to be assigned again. Use this when you have users picking from group task queues to prevent race conditions.

tools.name: getUserTask
tools.title: getUserTask
tools.description: Get user task by key. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

tools.name: searchUserTaskVariables
tools.title: searchUserTaskVariables
tools.description: Search user task variables based on given criteria. The variable value is returned in serialized JSON format. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

filter.description: Filter search by the given fields

after.description: Use the `endCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the next page of results.

before.description: Use the `startCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the previous page of results.

from.description: The index of items to start searching from.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in one request.

truncateValues.description: When true (default), long variable values in the response are truncated. When false, full variable values are returned.

tools.name: searchUserTasks
tools.title: searchUserTasks
tools.description: Search for user tasks. Variable values in filters need to be in serialized JSON format. Example string value: `\"myValue\"`. Example nested JSON value: `{\"myVar\":\"myValue\"}`. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

from.description: Filter from this time (inclusive). RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2024-12-17T10:30:00Z' or '2024-12-17T10:30:00+01:00').

to.description: Filter up to this time (exclusive). RFC 3339 format (e.g., '2024-12-17T10:30:00Z' or '2024-12-17T10:30:00+01:00').

assignee.description: The assignee of the user task.

elementId.description: The element ID of the user task.

elementInstanceKey.description: The key of the element instance.

name.description: The task name. This only works for data created with 8.8 and onwards. Instances from prior versions don't contain this data and cannot be found.

priority.description: The priority of the user task.

processDefinitionId.description: The ID of the process definition.

processDefinitionKey.description: The key of the process definition.

processInstanceKey.description: The key of the process instance.

tags.description: List of tags. Tags need to start with a letter; then alphanumerics, `_`, `-`, `:`, or `.`; length ≤ 100.

userTaskKey.description: The key for this user task.

filter.description: Filter search by the given fields

after.description: Use the `endCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the next page of results.

before.description: Use the `startCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the previous page of results.

from.description: The index of items to start searching from.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in one request.

tools.name: getVariable
tools.title: getVariable
tools.description: Get variable by key. The variable value is returned in serialized JSON format. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

tools.name: searchVariables
tools.title: searchVariables
tools.description: Search for variables. The variable value is returned in serialized JSON format. Note: Results are eventually consistent and may not immediately reflect recent changes.

isTruncated.description: Whether the value is truncated or not.

processInstanceKey.description: The key of the process instance of this variable.

scopeKey.description: The key of the scope of this variable.

value.description: Variable values in filters need to be in serialized JSON format. Example string value: `\"myValue\"`. Example nested JSON value: `{\"myVar\":\"myValue\"}`.

filter.description: Filter search by the given fields

after.description: Use the `endCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the next page of results.

before.description: Use the `startCursor` value from the previous response to fetch the previous page of results.

from.description: The index of items to start searching from.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in one request.

truncateValues.description: When true (default), long variable values in the response are truncated. When false, full variable values are returned.
